title: Patient Observation Task Training: Simulation-Based Deliberate Practice Curriculum

context.prior_knowledge: Basic patient care procedures and medical team collaboration experience
context.additional_context: Enhancing the continuous observation (CO) competencies of unlicensed medical assistants (PCAs) for patients exhibiting complex health behaviors through repetitive practice and feedback in simulation environments resembling real-life scenarios.

learning_goals: Application of observation strategies with over 80% accuracy according to various patient factors (mental state, physical characteristics) and environmental contexts (room layout, equipment availability)
Execution of appropriate response procedures in at least three simulations for non-repetitive challenging situations such as non-harmful behavior and aggressive reactions
Demonstration of complex communication to maintain patient safety through collaboration with staff from other departments (nurses, doctors, social workers) in at least four scenarios

resources: Low-Resource Environment Simulated Hospital Room Set
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
